text:
Hi <@UFBNA9K9A> i’m having a similar issue and wanted to know how you were able to solve this. I’m trying to use the subscription features within my app and running into 2 issues:
1. getting a 401 error when I use the `App id` as well as a `API Key` <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks> `"message": "Authentication credentials not found. This API supports both API Key and OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>"`
2. While the hasn’t yet been “verify”, similar status as Martin screenshot, i’m trying to install the app using OAuth, and while the process was successful, the app didn’t show up in neither my Staging, or Testing account.
Any thoughts would be super helpful
Hey <@U01GDKHFCV6> What account ID did you grab the API key from?  What account did you run through OAuth flow for (there should have been an account picker if you have logins for multiple accounts)

Hey <@UFBNA9K9A>, If by account ID you mean the portal Id, grab the id from the App testing portal. I also use the API key from here to run through the OAuth flow. But I copied the “Install URL (OAuth)” from the developer webhook
Looks like there was a “Get Hubpost API Key” button that I was missing. I’ll investigate this more and let you know if i have any question. Thanks
